The classic puzzle game we all know and love. The Gameboy version is by far the best selling and most popular - and one of the few versions with the iconic "Tetris" song (Korobeiniki). Due to the differences in scoring and gameplay across different Tetris versions this will be limited to the Gameboy release only. The score needed to "complete" this game should be discussed amongst the community. From Russia with fun!
Tired of GotW NOT being Golden Axe? Bummed that Zelda is disqualified this month? Vote for Sega’s answer to The Legend of Zelda that GamePro magazine scored a perfect 5/5
Some evil maniac has turned you into a green ooze in order to stop you to find evidence that crimes were being committed using a toxic gas you created.
Take control of Marina as she tries to rescue Dr. Theo from the evil emperor and his imperial army.
Remember Desert Strike? The helicopter game on the Genesis? Well eventually that game morphed into a futuristic mech game and this is that game.
Control spirits with the power of the armlet in this ARPG on the genesis. Solid combat mechanics and fun puzzles make this one my favorite Zelda-like of the 16-bit era. And Bill likes it too.
Awesome soundtrack and sense of speed, 60 frames per second with up to 30 vehicles on screen at the same time with no slow down. “You Got Boost Power!”
Kratos is back again. although earlier than ever before, experience the epic slash and hack prequel in glorious handheld
A classic indie metroidvania made by one guy.
Perfect Dark is a dystopian sci-fi FPS where you play as newly minted secret agent Joanna "Perfect" Dark, uncovering a sinister, very far reaching conspiracy.

The Tony Hawk games take the crown for best extreme sports series of all-time and Pro Skater 3 is a nice sweet spot for retro handhelds where you can choose to emulate 6th gen if your device can handle it or 5th gen if not.
Want something new? This is a game based on sound. Use stereo and doppler effect to locate sound-emitting objects. Can (and should) be played with closed eyes. Headphones mandatory.

Set in a crime-ridden Detroit, Michigan in 2043, RoboCop is a police officer who is brutally murdered and subsequently re-created as a super-human cyborg known as RoboCop. RoboCop is a beat 'em up/run-and-gun action game known for its high difficulty.

2D action/platformer. In the year 2056, you play a military agent who has transferred his brain into binary code in order to combat a virus in the main defense computer. You take on the image of a Kabuki dancer, like your ancestor, and attack with your hair.

The sequel to star fox/Lylat wars which was ultimately completed but not released - we got star fox 64 instead. But years later it was released as part of the SNES classic collection and can now be played on switch online.
Faselei! is a tactical role-playing game where players take on the role of Shotaro Kurosawa, member of the titular mercenary group, across thirteen story chapters.

HλLF-LIFE is a science fiction first-person shooter where the player takes the perspective of the scientist Gordon Freeman who struggles to escape an underground research facility after a failed experiment causes a massive alien invasion through a dimensional rift.
You are a man found inside a buried egg shaped robot in a deep slumber. Traverse this beautiful hand drawn adventure with 3D graphic boss battles.

Battle Network takes place during the 21st century in a world where society and everyday life is driven by the internet. Users are able to interact with and virtually explore nearly any electronic device using highly advanced, online avatars called "NetNavis". The game follows a young boy named Lan Hikari and his NetNavi MegaMan.EXE as they solve a series of crimes instigated by the "WWW (World Three)" organization. Rather than share the platform gameplay of its predecessors, Battle Network is a tactical role-playing game in which the player respectively controls Lan in the game's outside world and MegaMan.EXE in its virtual world. Battles take place in real-time; special abilities called "Battle Chips" can be accessed to fight off the numerous computer viruses present in the game's cyberspace environments.
Seattle, Washington in the year 2050, where the protagonist Jake Armitage is shown being gunned down in the street.

Factions vie for control over a post-apocalyptic Earth using giant mechs.  FromSoftware before the Souls era, AC3 serves as a reboot for the series that features the awesome combat and storytelling it is loved for.  Just in time for the new Armored Core coming soon!

The golden age of SNES Action RPGs. Control the Hero and his dog while he travels through 4 imagined worlds. Lots of weapons, alchemy, cheesy quotes and a morphing doggo. What else do you need to vote this jewel?
Explore the parallel worlds of Arcane magics of Arcadia, and the Technological marvel of Stark as you unravel a mystery around the balance of these two worlds

Robotrek, known in Japan as Slapstick, is a role-playing video game for the SNES. It was developed by Quintet and published by Enix in both Japan and North America in 1994. Set on the fictional planet Quintenix, the game puts the player in control of a budding robotics expert who is the son of a famous inventor. Build and battle robots!!!
Freeze enemy's and stab them to there doom, in this high jumping action platformer with a fast paced soundtrack.
In the future you can shatter things... WITH YOUR HANDS! A cult classic action-platformer featuring the Robotic Satellite system.

Pilot your mech in defense of your home planet in this beautiful run n gun on the Genesis. At your disposal is a jet pack, a varied arsenal of weapons like a pulse rifle and flame thrower, as well as a support vehicle that GamePro described as “Robocop on a Harley”
A Star Fox like space combat simulation game on the PS1. It got mixed reviews for being too short in its time, but has since made many underrated gem lists.

The greatest rhythm shooter in existence. Play as a hacker navigating cyberspace, combatting viruses and malware, by shooting them with a gun, until you can reach and awaken the AI. One of the most wonderful games ever made, with the combination of background soundtrack and gun noises combining wonderfully, and subconsciously making you time your shots alongside the music. A Fucking Joy. Never bettrered

Critically praised, yet a sales flop, Space Station Silicon Valley is one of the gems of the N64. Possess various animals, platform, and solve puzzles as you guide Evo the robot through the aforementioned space station.

The first ever console MMORPG, Phantasy Star Online features 3 different classes, 3 different races, and many weapons to ARPG your way through Ragol on the hunt for the fabled Red Ring Rico. What really happened to Pioneer 1? Are you brave enough to find out?
Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (KOTOR) is an  RPG video game based on the fictional universe of Star Wars by George Lucas set four thousand years before the films.

Mega Man 2 is an action game developed and published by Capcom for the Nintendo Entertainment System. It was released in Japan in 1988 and in North America and PAL regions the following years. Mega Man 2 continues Mega Man's battle against the evil Dr. Wily and his rogue robots. It introduced graphical and gameplay changes, many of which became series staples.
A side-scrolling beat ‘em up from Treasure, Omega Factor is an anime-inspired action game with light RPGish stat management.
Take to the skies during the Intercorporate War of 2040. Experience white knuckle aerial combat and a story with branching paths about the nature of loyalty, war, and even reality.
3D third person shooter where you play as a mech that can transform into a vehicle. Lovely chunky PS1 graphics. Killer soundtrack. Has ‘future’ in the title.
It's a futuristic racing game, and it's F-Zero. We don't play enough racing games, so let's play this one! Yes it's on the N64, it'll be fine I promise.

Play as Leo Stenbuck, the lone survivor after an attack on his home colony near Jupiter by the evil military organization known as BAHRAM. Take control of the orbital frame known as Jehuty, defend civilians and avenge those lost. Mechas, in space!

A remake of the original Metroid where the player controls bounty hunter Samus Aran, who travels to planet Zebes after learning that the Space Pirates are experimenting with Metroids, hostile parasitic creatures.

Advertised as a “CD Rom game on a cartridge”, with hand drawn backdrops and rotoscoped animations. The best selling French game of all time! Second sequel should be dropping this year too, so great time to play/replay the OG.
Beneath a Steel Sky is a point and click adventure game devised by director Charles Cecil and Watchman's comic book artist Dave Gibbons wich takes place in a distopian future.
Fly around levels and shoot everything that moves in this hectic, colourful, explosion-filled multidirectional 2d shmup from Treasure.
A fan retelling of the Game Boy title Metroid II, we continue Bounty Hunter Samus Aran's adventures, now on SR388, the home world of the titular Metroid species

Try out the legendary Super Metroid in a whole new way! Hyper Metroid is a hack made to give a new experience to something you've already played. Made for all ranges of players, this is no Kaizo Mario hack.
As the pilot of the titular Iron Soldier, it's your mission to protect the United Republic from the evil Penta Corp.
It's an RTS game from Aliens vs Predators franchise. You can play as Colonial Marines, Predators, and Aliens. Which one will you play as? Each factions have their own strengths and weaknesses.

There is a reason why Doug is namedropped twice in the game title. He’s bigger than life, and you can join him in his first, and last, video game, in which each player gets a different experience: beating the game consists of completing 3 quests randomly selected out of 20+ different ones, and ultimately meeting patty mayo in one of many possible endings.

Platform the chemical plant,  drive the Batmobile in Gotham city,  Solve the puzzle and identify the items tainted with the Joker’s poison.  Fly the batwing and ultimately climb the Gotham cathedral and confront the Joker
It's a fighting game based off a fighting movie based off a fighting game. What more is there to say?

The game is focused around the Mariner's (the main character) trimaran, which the player moves around a 3-D world, shooting enemies on personal water crafts called Smokers. It is a form of 3D shoot 'em up, similar to that of the All-Range Mode in Star Fox 64.

One of Capcom's final (and greatest) entries into the side-scrolling beat-em-up genre, choose from one of 6 different playable characters in this fantasy romp through the Dungeons & Dragons universe with light RPG elements.
A fun 3D beat-‘em-up with fighting game mechanics and a Die Hard license thrown in.
Play as the Simpsons family and Abu in this gta-esque game to uncover the mysterious things happening in Springfield.

A 3D-platformer collect-a-thon where you play as SpongeBob, Patrick, and Sandy to stop Plankton's army of robots  from destroying Bikini Bottom. An updated Rehydrated version of this game is also available.
Travel back to a simpler time and play "classic games" with the inimitable Shinya Arino. Kachō On!

Embark on a journey with Ed and Al in this beat-em-up. They take a break from their main story of searching for the Philosopher's Stone and track  down a new object called the "Philosopher's Catalyst". Will this new object be what they've been searching for all this time?!
Rogue Spear focuses on realism, planning, strategy and teamwork.

Some souls need to be killed? Sounds like a job for the Shadow Man. Venture into the underworld and collect the Dark Souls as the Shadow Man, platforming and shooting your way to victory. Based on the comic of the same name.
Based on Dororo by the god of Manga Osama Tezuka, the main character must travel and battle demons to regain body his parts that were taken at birth.

Set after the events of the anime series, .hack//Sign, the games focus on the character Kite and his quest to discover why some users have become comatose in the real world as a result of playing The World--the most popular action MMORPG ever made.

Who would win in a fight between Goku and Naruto ? Gon Freks and Ichigo ? Bobobo-bo and Aralé? It's time to settle the debate with this fighting game featuring more than 300 manga characters from Jump magazine, with 56 of them playable.
It’s Batman! Defeat the Joker save the city.
Travel around the world in the greatest NES platformer as Scrooge McDuck to become the world’s richest duck.

Play as Mickey or Donald as they use their magic capes to go through the world of illusion in one of the best platformers on the genesis. This game has no right to be as good as it is. Plus it's a nice short 2 hour jaunt. May contain violence.

Buster Busts Loose might be one of the most lovely crafted licensed games in existence. So much fan service and attention to detail to replicate the show as much as possible, from transitions between each level them reminiscing introducing the next cartoon, to the awesome 16-bit compilations of the show’s tunes. Konami could have just made a platformer and called it a day but they didn’t, they went all out.
Enjoy the pinnacle of 2D platforming with some great graphics and amazing soundtrack (Mega Drive for original music). Everyone needs to play this at least once in their lifetime.
Infamous among all 90's kids, this side scrolling platformer is one of the best movie tie-in games ever released. Follow Simba in his journey from a young cub to king of pride rock.

Search for Reptar follows the cartoon's main character, Tommy Pickles, who has lost his Reptar puzzle. It features stages that are typically based on episodes from the television show. It is a 3D platform game which requires players to control several of the main characters in order to accomplish the goals.
It's a jet no it's a robot now it's a mash up of both! Transforming mecha destroying alien scum it's Robotech need I say more.

Zoids are big mechs in the shap of animals that might have feelings but definitely have guns. Use them to navigate a weird time travel storyline and beat up other robots. Pretty great game, and the retranslation patch fixes the weird nonsense story.
Play through the story of DB/DBZ from the 23rd Tenkaichi Budokai through the epic Saiyan Saga in this turn-based RPG!

Amnesiac player character awakes aboard a doomed starship and must escape and discover the secrets of his or her past whilst unravelling a Galaxy-spanning Sith plot. Considered one of the greatest RPGs ever made, take on the role of a Jedi and either save or doom the galaxy through your choices. Featuring a rich dialogue-filled plot, DnD 3e based combat system, plenty of weapon and power choices, and a rich cast of supporting characters and squad members to bring aboard the super cool Ebon Hawk freighter.
Let's do some cart racing with everyone's favorite plastic floor hazards! Customize your minifig and your cart and share them with the server. Choro Who?
A side-scrolling beat ‘em up from Treasure, Omega Factor is an anime-inspired action game with light RPGish stat management.

In a game that was not even slightly influenced by that other Capcom game Phoenix Write, you play a lawyer who alternates between examining crime scenes and cross examining witnesses in a courtroom in order to prove your client - usually Hanna-Barbera character - innocent. Features a cameo from a Street Fighter 2 character in each case
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder’s Revenge, a sidescrolling beat ‘em up that aims to recapture the spirit of the TMNT arcade games from decades past
Take command of a advance ballistic missile submarine in this side-scrolling action game, as you try to defect and escape Soviet waters in the late Cold War era.

The player controls Dr. Alan Grant, a paleontologist who has become trapped at Jurassic Park. The game's exterior portion is viewed from a top-down perspective, but shifts to a first-person view whenever the player enters a building.

Released during the peak of the Monday Night Wars, this game was praised for its focus on grappling and strategic play over button mashing.  Features popular WCW and NWO wrestlers like Sting, Ric Flair, Hulk Hogan, and The Outsiders.

In this 2D side-scrolling beat 'em up, special items can be collected throughout each stage, including those that increase the player's health and/or ki, and Dragon Balls. Clearing the story mode unlocks the ability to play as Krillin. The story mode is divided in various stage types; including standard platforming levels, flying stages, and one-on-one battles.

Play a role in the elite White Dingo Squadron as they battle against the Principality of Zeon during the universal century timeline. Players pilot mobile suits through a first-person cockpit view while also employing team-tactics with two AI-controlled teammates.

Willow is a 2D Action RPG developed and published by Capcom for the Nintendo Entertainment System. It is loosely based on the 1988 film of the same name. Willow is an adventure game in the vein of The Legend of Zelda where the player takes the role of Willow, who wages a battle against evil, wielding swords, shields, magic spells, and items to defeat enemies.
UUUEEEGGHH?!?!? Play as Tim ‘The Tool Man’ Taylor as he traverses across different TV show sets to find his missing power tools.

Enjoy this faithful RPG adaptation of the first instalment in the Harry Potter series. Attend classes, learn spells, fight foes, and live the life of a student in the most famous school of Wizardry. Can you uncover all secrets of Hogwarts?
Kinda like Mario 64, but you're Buzz Lightyear
Control Rodney Copperbottom, his trusty Wonderbot and even Bigweld in an action puzzle game where you can create and upgrade new tools as you progress the game.
Play as Jimmy Barnes in this Action Sports Adventure as he dances his way to the World Interpretive Dance Championships. Will Jim earn the heart of his life time love Natasha Sultana?

Return to Middle-earth in a game based on the epic final chapter of the The Lord of the Rings movie trilogy. Developed using the same digital assets as the films, The Return of the King recreates in stunning detail the final events of the War of the Ring. Choose from playable characters like Gandalf, Aragorn, Legolas, Gimli, Sam, and Frodo -- all voiced by the actual movie actors. The fate of Middle-earth is in your hands.

The absolute worst has happened: Yellow Duck has gone missing! It's up to Maus and Elephant to find him. In this riveting action / puzzle game based on the German children's television program: Die Sendung mit der Maus (The show with the mouse), you control both main characters, the mouse and the elephant, in a search for the duck who has disappeared. The levels of the game are isometric puzzles. Both characters must reach the exit using and combining their different abilities. The mouse, for instance, is larger than the elephant, but the elephant is able to push heavy objects around. The game contains more than 150 puzzles in 5 different game worlds.

The latest translated Choro Q game is said to be the stepping stone between the old, classic Choro Q games and the new, more heavily CarPG focused games. Race, upgrade your car and do quests in the over world; Talk about Wonderful!
Prehistoric platformer where you throw rocks and bump enemies with your big caveman belly.
Play as one of the four Ninja Turtles in this rad Beat em' Up through the Ages!

Broken Sword: The Shadow of the Templars is a classic point-and-click adventure game that takes players on a thrilling journey through time and history. One of the most notable aspects of the game is its intriguing storyline, which delves into the mysteries of the medieval Knights Templar. As players progress through the game, they are transported back to the age of the Templars, uncovering secrets and conspiracies along the way.

Gladiator is a brawling arena fighter with customizable characters, a neat left hand / right hand control scheme, and light RPG elements in the campaign as you murder your way out of debt slavery by choosing and upgrading the right equipment to suit the various scenarios your fighter is thrust into for the amusement of the Populus Romanus.

Climb a tower as you explore four unique major worlds that make up different layers of the tower: the World of Continent at the base, the World of Ocean on the, the World of Sky, and the World of Ruins.
Play a remake of the third game in the Ys series, but this time with actually good gameplay! Fight your way through a challenging and rewarding game while listening to absolutely kickass music!
Play as Gabriel "Gabe" Logan and his partner Lian Xing. to investigate a series of biological outbreaks, triggered by international terrorist group Black Baton, led by Erich Rhoemer.

An action role-playing game developed and published by Square for the PlayStation. The story is split between two protagonists in search of an ancient relic said to grant any wish; the amnesiac Rue who seeks to revive a dead friend, and the banished princess Mint who dreams of conquering the world. Gameplay focuses on action-based combat while exploring dungeon levels featuring minor platforming elements.

A crossover between pokémon and the acclaimed Nobunaga's Ambition, pokémon Conquest takes elements from both series to create a fun and unique tactical experience. Perfect for both newcomers and veterans of the genre, pokémon Conquest lets everyone experience the fun of tactics.
One of the greatest games ever made. Save hyrule and defeat the demon king Ganon.

Take control of an interactive mystery novel and discover the secrets of Hotel Dusk. Who is Kyle Hyde- and what really happened in Room 215? Take stylus in hand and navigate a tangled web of lies, betrayal, and murder to learn the answers.
Vanguard Bandits is a support-centric strategy RPG featuring tactical combat in a medieval fantasy world in which knights and soldiers pilot mecha.

Lets travel back to the ancient times of 1986 to rid a city of the old crime lords to become the one and only kingpin. Great tunes and the ability to ride ancient vehicles like motorcycles and cars with gasoline engines.

Journey to medieval Persia to defeat the evil grand vizier Jafar and save the princess! Experience the fluid realistic movement animations of 'rotoscoping', in a tense, timed cinematic platforming adventure.

Star in your own 1950s B-Movie when you play as a scientist investigating a meteor strike who finds the local townsfolk acting WEIRD. An adventure with mini-games (FPS, Driving, Top-down run/fight). Try to work out what’s going on before the town is overrun. If you fail, use what you learnt to do better next time (like The Outer Wilds).
A long time ago in a galaxy far far away…
Epic medieval fantasy themed side scrolling beat ‘em up with branching paths, multiple endings, and light ROG elements

Choose one of four teams to drive for and compete in the Real Racing Roots ‘99 Grand Prix in this classic racing game. Regarded as one of the best racers on the system and still beloved as the best game in the ridge racer franchise.

Fire Emblem,[a] also officially known as Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade, is a tactical role-playing game developed by Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy Advance handheld video game console. It is the seventh installment in the Fire Emblem series,[b] the second to be released for the platform after Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade, and the first to be localized for international audiences. It was released in Japan and North America in 2003, and in Europe and Australia in 2004.
A compilation of the first 2 psx games. You are a boy trying to save his sick mother in a fun cellshaded fantasy rpg
A classic JRPG with an interesting sense of humor which is centered around western culture in a modern setting.
Join Donald Duck doing his best Indiana Jones impression. Explore ANCIENT ruins, ghost ships and the urban jungle armed with your trusty plunger gun and a bad temper.
Disneys Hercules is a 1997 platform game based on the 1997 film of the same name.

One of the best games on the Saturn, and according to some one of the best games of all time! This turn-based TRPG has you playing Synbios, a young lord who must protect your homeland Aspinia against the forces of Destonia. Develop friendships, upgrade to a bunch of neat classes, and discover the true motives behind the conflict.

In the ancient times of 1995, you play Solid Snake a rookie member of a special forces group called FOXHOUND. Your mission (if you choose) is to infiltrate a fortress in search of a missing agent. Stealth your way through Hideo Kojima's first fully developed game!
Top down action hack 'n slash dungeon crawling RPG for the TurboGrafx-16. The story takes place in underground dungeons. Players can choose from eight different character types.
Get jiggy with the blinged-out ToeJam or his fresh homeslice Earl as they escape from a roguelike planet with negative funk

Action RPG that uses an overhead viewpoint for story-telling 'town' areas, but switches to a side-on view similar to Cadash to provide the thrills. Set in the Middle East in the 1100s. Nominating any version of Exile 1.

Super Ghouls 'n Ghosts is a side-scrolling platform game with reduced emphasis on run and gun and more on platforming.[2][3] As in the predecessor Ghosts 'n Goblins, the player takes the role of the knight Arthur, who must save Princess Guinevere and rid the kingdom of the Ghoul Realm which is revived under a spell of Emperor Sardius (known as Samael in the Japanese version), who has kidnapped Guinevere in the Phantom Zone.
Guide Richter Belmont through Dracula’s castle as he tries to save his beloved Annette and others kidnapped by Dracula’s servants.
Live out a samurai movie with action adventure gameplay. The plot changes with variations based on the choices you make, so each completion is unique. Play it again and again to see every plot!

The creators of Final Fantasy Tactics bring you the next evolution in Tactics games from Square Enix in Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together! A dream team lead by Yasumi Matsuno has reunited to bring a perfect vision of their lost tale of political intrigue, conquest, and rebellion to vivid life. Experience an epic story where your choices determine the fate of the Walister Resistance.
A young boy named Justin inherits a magic stone that leads him on a journey around the world to uncover the mystery of a long-lost civilization.
Cave Noire is a rougelike for the Gameboy, built to pick up and play in short sessions. It's easy to learn, tough to beat, and has some excellent music.

In a conflict between insane Middle Eastern dictator General Kilbaba and the United States, you control an Apache helicopter and attempt to destroy enemy weapons and installations, rescue hostages and capture enemy personnel, while managing supplies of fuel and ammunition.

An Action RPG similar in format to the original NES The Legend of Zelda video game, throughout the adventure, Willow travels through various locations and villages of the kingdom of Bavmorda, and solves quest original to the game.
Zombies have hit the home town now!
This time in a 2D side-scroller, Lara Croft finds an ancient sword in an antiquities museum while an ancient witch threatens to come back to life.
Travel to the past in order to save your tribe, throw orbs and fire lasers while exploring the castle together with your familiar.

Wolfenstein 3D is an episodic first-person shooter where the player assumes the role of Allied spy William "B.J." Blazkowicz during World War II as he escapes from the Nazi German prison Castle Wolfenstein and carries out a series of crucial missions against the Nazis. The player traverses each of the game's levels to find an elevator to the next level or kill a final boss, fighting Nazi soldiers, dogs, and other enemies with knives and a variety of guns.
Based on a modified DOOM engine, this medeival fps sees the player using magic weaponry to storm castles full of the undead in order to take vengeance on the serpent rider D'Sparil.
I am Turok! Take on the role of dinosaur hunter Turok and engage in thrilling first person dinosaur shooting action!

Play as a Pink Haired Caveman is this unique metroidvania as the player explores, solves puzzles, and beats evil pigs. From tokuro Fujiwara who worked on hit games like Mega Man 2-7, Ghosts and Goblins, Strider, Ducktales, and many more.
Journey back to the distant time of 1959 and experience the panic of the cold war as an alien invader.

Spanning a period of over a billion years, the game's story involves Gaia, daughter of the sun and mystical embodiment of the Earth, guiding the player through five distinct geological periods of the planet's history. Beginning the game as a fish, the player must travel across the planet defeating enemies and gaining the strength to evolve into more powerful and complex organisms before eventually earning a chance to enter the paradise realm of Eden, becoming Gaia's immortal partner.
King Arthur's World is a 1992 side-scrolling strategy video game.
The player's ultimate objective is to build a tower of mammoth tusks that reaches the sun.

The player controls an avatar shaped like a pair of eyes who explores a mansion seeking out parts of an urn to return to the entrance. A game of many firsts: earliest horror game, first player controlled scrolling, and, controversially, the first survival horror game.

The player controls a knight named Sir Arthur, who must defeat zombies, giants (referred to as "big men"), demons, forest spirits, and other monsters to rescue Princess Prin-Prin, who has been kidnapped by Astaroth (also called the Devil or Great Satan), king of Demon World. Along the way, the player can pick up new weapons, bonuses, and extra suits of armor that can help in this task. The bosses on each level include cyclopes, dragons, and powerful demons referred to as Satans.

Laplace no Ma is a mix of survival horror and JRPG where you’ll explore a small American town, complete with spooky mansion! Choose your party and unravel the mysteries of Newcam, Massachusetts with 1920's flair!
An action-platformer by Konami, considered a parody of the Castlevania series. Swiping his father's cape, it's up to Kid Dracula to destroy the demon Galamoth.

Play as Chuck D. Head a headless mummy created by the mad scientist Dr. Frank N. Stein. Your on a crusade to defeat Max D. Cap and his underworld army of monsters all on a island shaped as a skeleton (ohhh so very creepy).

A spooky game where you need to save a house full of sleepover guests from being murdered in comical ways. Is also the reason we have the ESRB ratings that we do on games now. Or at least, was used as the scapegoat for it
Doom is a groundbreaking first-person shooter that popularized the genre, immersing players in fast-paced combat against hordes of demons and otherworldly creatures in maze-like environments.

Discover the secrets of mysterious toymaker Henry Stauf by exploring his macabre mansion and solving puzzles. Stauf was known for making toys for children based on his dreams until the children started mysteriously dying. He then built a mansion using his toy fortune only to disappear. Now you and a handful of others have been invited to his mansion only find that he isn't there, instead you're tasked with solving puzzles and playing through a game for which you don't have the rules.

One or two players take control of the protagonists, Zeke and Julie, in order to rescue the titular neighbors from monsters often seen in horror movies. Aiding them in this task are a variety of weapons and power-ups that can be used to battle the numerous enemies in each level.

Another in a long line of Japanese anime/manga turned Super Famicom video game adaptation, GeGeGe no Kitarō is one of the strangest SNES games you could ever encounter. It’s a side-scrolling shoot ‘em up platformer

The prequel to Castlevania Symphony of the Night following Richter Belmont, and the last console Classic Castlevaniagame before the major shift to Metroidvanias with it's sequel Symphony of the Night. Probably the best classic style Castlevania game to boot with excellent graphics and music, some branching stages and bonus endings, a second playable character, and a hard but fair difficulty.

The player assumes the identity of a young Texas businessman named Alexander Morris, who has come to London during the winter of 1899 to research the strange surroundings involving his brother Quincey's death 10 years earlier. In the process, he meets an English woman named Annisette Bowen and becomes engaged to marry her.
Five years after the events of Splatterhouse 2, Rick must don the mask for the third time and fight the monsters that have invaded his mansion and kidnapped his wife Jennifer and son David.
From the developer of Dark Souls and Armored Core comes the precursor to the Souls series. Die, explore, fight, and die again as you try to stop a dark power.

World-famous archaeologist and famed scholar Doctor Hauzer has mysteriously vanished, and Adam, a reporter who frequently covers his work, decides to track him down. His search leads him to a decrepit mansion on the outskirts of town. What awaits him in the sinister darkness where the mysterious doctor lurks?
Play as one of the titular brothers as they fight to find their way home in this 3D Megami Tensei spin-off. Hee ho!

Quake is a first-person shooter where players must find their way through various maze-like, medieval environments while battling monsters using an array of weaponry and takes inspiration from gothic fiction and the works of H. P. Lovecraft.

Resident Evil is a 1996 survival horror video game developed and published by Capcom originally for the PlayStation. It is the first game in Capcom's Resident Evil franchise. Players control Chris Redfield and Jill Valentine, members of the elite task force S.T.A.R.S., who must escape a mansion infested with zombies and other monsters.

In Blood Omen, the player follows Kain, a slain nobleman newly resurrected as a vampire. Seeking revenge against his murderers and a cure to his vampiric curse, Kain is tasked with traversing the fictional land of Nosgoth and slaughtering the Circle of Nine
There are aliens and you have guns.
Playing as Ickis, Oblina, or Krumm, the player explores various locales collecting specific items and scaring specific people the Gromble instructs the player to.

The swansong of the Point-n-Click era, the PnC without the pointing or clicking (it introduced joystick controls and an ability to indicate interactive ‘hotspots’ so you wouldn’t need to “go searching” with a mouse pointer) and still considered the pinnacle of the genre, you play as a grim reaper has to investigate corruption within the afterlife, in a mix of Mexican folklore and film noire. Praised for the savvy and funny dialogue, this is the one that seems to constantly be near the top of all pre-2000 “best game ever lists”. This is the adventure game for people who don’t’ like Point and Click controls. This is also the dictionary definition of a macabre game
Survival horror on the Saturn that’s got the added stress of juggling an oxygen meter on top of everything else!

Baroque is set in a post-apocalyptic world where an experiment to understand the Absolute God caused devastating climate change, with surviving humans becoming physically twisted by manifestations of guilt. This experiment was led by a being called Archangel. The protagonist is guided by Archangel through the Neuro Tower to find the Absolute God and fix the world. All versions of the game feature dungeon-crawling through randomly-generated floors of the Neuro Tower, with deaths in the dungeon advancing the narrative. The original uses a first-person perspective, which the remake includes a third-person camera and adjustable difficulty levels.

Aya is back and so is that pesky mitochondria. Instead of the turn based rpg style of the first one, the sequel is more action based/survival horror. It still retains some of that rpg goodness though.

This prequel to the Shadow Hearts series is set in the haunted Nemeton Monastery in Wales, the plot follows protagonists Koudelka Iasant, Edward Plunkett and Bishop James O'Flaherty as they uncover Nemeton's secrets and confront monsters created from its dark past. Its gameplay blends exploration and puzzle elements with turn-based battles waged on a grid.

A Skull Kid possessed by Majora's Mask is pulling down the moon to crash on the land of Termina. Using his Ocarina to manipulate time, Link must live through the same 3 days; beating 4 dungeons and multiple side quests to stop the apocalypse.

Play as Ashley Riot, a Riskbreaker exploring the link between a cult leader and a senior Parliament member, Duke Bardorba, in the Kingdom of Valendia. Using a pauseable real-time combat mechanic (similar to Parasite Eve) and deep weapon crafting system, fight your way through undead, phantoms, beasts, and other unsettling enemies as you explore the catacombs of the ruined city Leá Monde.
You take the role of a Graveyard Keeper, protecting your graves from various monsters and dealing with bosses that fill up entire screens. Incredibly addictive game and a great co-op.

Jack Ingles, member of a special forces team, is sent on a mission to investigate an aircraft carrier that has not been responding to radio contact after completing a mission. When your helicopter is shot down, you must explore the ship and survive the unfathomable horrors within...

Count Dracula has been resurrected and evil will reign supreme unless he is stopped. As Nathan Graves, you'll hunt down the count and use your whip and a variety of special items to destroy his minions. Battle your way through Dracula's castle and rid the world of evil once and for all!
The critically acclaimed sequel to the original silent hill and often considered one of the greatest games on the PS2.

Scooby-Doo! Night of 100 Frights is a third person platform game with action elements that puts players in the control of Scooby-Doo in a story that revolves around him searching for the rest of the gang around a haunted mansion after they are kidnapped by an eccentric villain. The game has twelve areas, ranging from graveyards and secret labs to fishing villages and haunted mazes.

After your brother goes missing in a mansion looking for a novel writer, you decide to find out what has happened! Equipped with your trusty camera you venture into the haunted unknown to do battle with ghost!

Following in his father's footsteps, you play Django the vampire hunter, who uses the power of the sun to defeat the many evil beings that infest the world. Search lairs for the evil inside, and destroy the immortal that rules the area.
Manhunt is a controversial and gory stealth horror game where you go against the worst humanity itself has to offer in a sadistic game of cat and mouse.

The game centers on the 13-year-old Ashley Mizuki Robbins, who travels to Blood Edward Island and is in search for her father Richard Robbins and the truth behind mysterious events in her childhood. A diary from Ashley's perspective was written as a prologue for the game which can be read before playing it.

Slapstick action-adventure game in a "twisted noir" setting where you play Fred, recently-murdered and mad-scientist-revived private eye voiced by John McGinley.  Swap your brain-in-a-jar head for enemy's heads and gain their totally rad powers to traverse the levels, fight enemies, and solve your own murder-mystery.
You wake up as Harry Mason and try to unravel you memories

Danganronpa is a visual novel that’s similar to ace attorney, the game is about a group of students trapped in a school by a evil bear called Monokuma and the only way to get out of the school is killing each other. The game is split in two segments the school part where you can interact with people and objects, and then there’s the class trials, it’s when you are trying to find the culprit.
Play as a little girl named Ib as she navigates an art gallery that is much more than it seems in this surreal and influential RPGMaker horror game.

Welcome to Ghost Trick, where you're already dead and have no idea who you are. Help Sissel rediscover his memory and find out who he is and who killed him.  Interact with the environment as spirit to change fate, meet a whacky cast of characters, and discover the answers to mysteries as a phantom detective!

The player controls a child who has fallen into the Underground. Player can choose to pacify or subdue monsters. These choices affect the game, with the dialogue, characters, and story changing based on outcomes. What will you choose?
Lavender died recently and became a reaper, so she has to fight ghosts in order to find her brother's soul to guide him into afterlife.

Play as justice seeking vigilante Nox "Nightser" Francisca and his dagger adept girlfriend Veronica Mimieux. Grind your way through the eerie town of St. Crypton and stop your best friend Vlad Drachovi from raising the dead before midnight strikes on All Hallows Eve!
Battle dragons and evil ninjas as you try to shave a few points off your short game in this unique sports/beat 'em up hybrid.

In retrospective coverage, Sapphire is considered one of the best PC Engine shoot 'em ups. Although the gameplay was found to be average, critics concluded that the graphics and sound were of such incredible quality that they made up for any shortcomings in the game mechanics. Sapphire was produced in low numbers at the end of the PC Engine's lifespan and subsequently became a rare collector's item.

An early release on the Sega Saturn, it was largely ignored for being a 2D platformer on a system expected to produce 3D titles, but its graphics have aged better than 3D titles of the time. Its box art on the other hand...

Harmful Park: High-brow Gag and Pure Shooting is a 1997 horizontally scrolling shooter video game developed and published by Sky Think System for the PlayStation in Japan. Set in a theme park, the game has been described as a cute 'em up and resembles Konami's Parodius games. It has become somewhat of a collector's item, and one of the rarest shooters on the PlayStation. Despite what the awful cover would have you think, there's nothing about gags or breakfasts in the game.

Wendy accidentally opens her aunts' chest containing magical stones, which upset the gravity of a floating castle that crashes onto her house. The player controls Wendy through four worlds with sixteen levels, with each world having three side-scrolling levels and one horizontal shooter stage.
This box art stands out on every shelf, and its a great isometric sci-fi exploration game too.
The four Warriors of Light are tasked by the King of Cornelia to rescue Princess Sarah from Garland. This sets them off on an adventure to defeat the Four Fiends and rescue the world.
In the future you can shatter things... WITH YOUR HANDS! A cult classic action-platformer featuring the Robotic Satellite system.

This JAP and PAL only 2D run and gun, heavily influenced by Gunstar Heroes, lets you shoot your way to the legendary Valkyrie treasure. You can use four weapons unique to each of the two characters and move with your grappling hook.

This is an incredibly kickass on-rails shooter from Treasure that is every bit as good as any Star Fox or Panzer Dragoon game.  Play as either Saki or Airan while fighting off mutants in Japan in the distant dystopian future of 2007.  While initially only released in Japan, all the dialogue is in English anyway so this is an easy one to play even without a translation patch.

Take control of a muscle car, compete in races and different skill tests sponsored by Hooters Restaurants. The winner of these races will get to meet a real Hooters Girl (video wise of course), chosen for the game for each state they actually live (i.e., if they player wins a race in Florida, the player will get to see a Hooters Girl from a restaurant in Florida). There are 12 different cars to choose from, some of which need to be unlocked by winning certain races.
Turn based military strategy game. Think advance wars, but in space, because the box clearly shows the earth in space, so it can’t be there.

Eve the robot has crashed their ship, leaving them started on the space station. Take control of animals to platform and solve puzzles in this commercial flop but critical success. Plus the box art is absolutely horrendous.
Take control of a general's son and go around to find 108 friends! A game where the USA boxart is so ugly the wiki doesn't even use it.

Rebelstar is a 24-stage tactical RPG that focuses on the long-range combat of guns and grenades over swords and sorcery. There are some interesting design choices here like fog of war, a morale system, and a constant balance between moving further versus attacking.

This game needs no introductions. Even though the covers that everyone knows are really good, the Japanese versions are ar superior, in my opinion. The yellow version is slightly different os that one dosen't count for this nomination sadly.

Play as Alphonse Loeher, a knight of Lodis, sent to quell rebellion in the region of Ovis, but the mission is not as simple as it seems. Recruit allies, fight in tactical, grid-based RPG fashion, and learn the truth of the atrocities of Lodis. Features five possible endings.
Join Sora, Donald and Goofy in this mash up of Disney and Final Fantasy. Maybe the real Kingdom Hearts is the friends we made along the way?
Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (KOTOR) is an  RPG video game based on the fictional universe of Star Wars by George Lucas set four thousand years before the films.
See where it all began. Guide Simon Belmont through Count Dracula’s castle in the original Classicvania.

The golden Sun games have some of the most awesome boxart on the gba. Plus we played Golden Sun 1 last year, so many players have data they can migrate to continue the adventure. And those who didn’t can play golden Sun 1 and get a point under GOTY. Two for the price of one.
We've already played the first one, now it's time to play the sequel. Wikipedia has Awesome Japanese cover art, but check out the contrast to this AWFUL American cover art.

Taking place on planet Gaia, the story follows a thief named Zidane Tribal, a member of a thief troupe who is tasked to kidnap the princess of Alexandria, Garnet Til Alexandros XVII. He teams up with her and a team of allies to stop Queen Brahne and her ally Kuja from waging war with an army of black mages.

The player uses samples of serum lying around to transform into one of five different animals (Muckster the Cat, Doh-Doh the Duck, Oozy the Mouse, Goopy the Guppy, and Globmeister the Gopher) Move over BLAST Processing and welcome BLAZE Processing!
An action-platfomer by Capcom, and a sequel to Gargoyle's Quest. Firebrand must recover six magical stones and unite the power of the Demon's Crest.

You have been framed so now it's time to bust out of jail and clear your name. Switch between 4 playable characters (Kunio, Riki and their girlfriends) with their own unique special moves. Also you get to ride a motorcycle and fight like in Road Rage. Time to kick butt and take names. Translation patch available.

Stay alive in a life sim where you are a single lifeform placed on an alien planet that is being terraformed. This game did not make it out of Japan due to poor sales, but is now a cult classic. Was it the cover art that scared consumers away?
Kao is a young kangaroo living with his family in the jungle when they are one day captured by a ruthless hunter and his goons. It's up to Kao to drive the invaders from his home and save his family.

When the King of All Cosmos "accidentally" destroys all the stars in the sky (oh, and the moon) after a night of drunken debauchery, it's up to his son, the Prince, to roll up a lot of stuff in his Katamari so the King can create new stars.

Resident Evil is a 1996 survival horror video game developed and published by Capcom originally for the PlayStation. It is the first game in Capcom's Resident Evil franchise. Players control Chris Redfield and Jill Valentine, members of the elite task force S.T.A.R.S., who must escape a mansion infested with zombies and other monsters.
Awesome or Awful artwork? Depends where you live! Either way, this game is fantastic and influenced a lot of your favorites.

Dragon Quest, titled Dragon Warrior when initially localized to North America, is a role-playing video game developed by Chunsoft for the Nintendo Entertainment System. The player controls the hero character who is charged with saving the Kingdom of Alefgard and rescuing its princess from the evil Dragonlord.

Ghost Lion begins when a ghostly White Lion attacked Maria's village. A hero appeared and drove the lion away, but Maria's parents wanted to find out where the Lion came from and what its purpose was. They set out on a journey, and never returned. The player takes control when, one day, Maria decides to go look for them.

Retrospectively considered one of the best Sonic games, and a favorite of all our favorite YouTubers for benchmarking. This would be the first Sonic game in an age to win GotM. Also look at the effing terrible boxart.
You’re Billy Bob and you gotta earn the heart of your sweetie by hunting and fishing! Collect bait, bullets, and beer while avoiding the DNR in your excursions.
This game is unique in many ways. It’s exclusive to North America. It’s an RTS for Game Boy Color, and a great one. And where else have you seen a pig with a sword?

Dragon's Lair, the fantasy adventure where you become a valiant knight on a quest to rescue the fair princess from the clutches of an evil dragon. You control the actions of a daring adventurer finding his way through the castle of a dark wizard who has enchanted it with treacherous monsters and obstacles. In the mysterious caverns below the castle your odyssey continues against the awesome forces that oppose your efforts to reach the dragon's lair. Lead on, adventurer, your quest awaits!
The granddaddy of joy, the first Super Mario Bros. revolutionized the platforming genre and set a new standard for game design.

This game brings me the joy of memories. I played at my house as my Aunt did at her house, and we would meet  up weekly, and exchange maps and notes because this was in a time _before_ widespread internet. Also, just finishing TOTK, I'm taking a journey back through the timelines, and havent played the OG in a few years, so what better way to reexperience the joy than to drag others with me
Following the events of Bubble Bobble, Bubby and Bobby set out to defeat the "Dark Shadow" and rescue the Rainbow Islands.

Play as one of two twins who are trying to rescue their parents, by grabing enemies and then repeatedly throwing them over your head and into the floor, a bit like Hulk does to Loki in the first Avengers film. Tremendious fun.

Play as the king of pop to save children from Mr. Big. You can dance, you can jive, having the time of your life (wrong server)... with your sparkles all around the place. They'll kick you, then they'll beat you, then they'll tell you it's fair, so beat it!

Nostalgia trip for those of us that grew up watching the Tiny Toon Adventures TV show; I owned this game as a kid but never beat it. Very fun and well reviewed platformer where you play as the titular Buster Bunny.
Join the bunny-like Yakopoo on his quest to find the flower of peace and heal his broken world in this rare classic.

Like its predecessor Kirby's Dream Land (1992), Kirby's Adventure is a 2D side-scrolling platform game. In the game's scenario, an evil entity named Nightmare corrupts the Fountain of Dreams, which provides restful sleep to the residents of Dream Land.

There’s a legend at Kirameki High School that if a girl confesses their love for you under a certain tree, you’ll have happiness forever. Pursue one of the ladies of your high school, but don’t piss any of them off. You’ll regret it.
The adventure of a generation and the game that made me fall in love with the medium.
There's always been something special about this game

Cruis'n USA thrusts you into a high-octane adventure, letting you blaze through a vivid, digitized America, from the towering redwoods of California to the bustling streets of New York City. With a range of gleaming, powerful cars at your disposal, every race in this adrenaline-fueled game is a thrilling spectacle of speed, competition, and discovery.
Wario wants treasures and money. The more you get, the happiest the ending will be. Unlike Mario, Wario can tackle enemies. And his jet makes Mario’s tanooki suit look ridiculous.

Set 1000 years of Lunar: The Silver Star,  this sequel continues the feeling of adventure and an upbeat fulfill your dreams story that Game Arts is known for. Enjoy Working Designs' artistic liberties taken to fill the dialogue with one-liners and 90s pop references.

Set in a high fantasy world, the game follows three heroes as they attempt to claim the legendary Mana Sword and prevent the Benevodons from being unleashed and destroying the world. It features three main plotlines and six different possible main characters, each with their own storylines, and allows two players to play simultaneously.
My first megaman, and while not my favorite, it always makes me happy to replay through this one.
A platform game full of color, good music and a good story, which will certainly create good moments for those who play it.
Mario's first RPG Adventure, the first game I ever beat on my own as a kid, and the first game my wife and I played together when we started dataing. Also, the only game with Geno: the GOAT.
Have you ever seen a sad person on a WaveRunner? Have you? Seriously, have you? Try to frown on a WaveRunner. You can’t!
What's more enjoyable than smashing cars together with friends? Smashing cars together by yourself? Maybe.

This is my go-to comfort game that has stuck with me throughout my life. Friends, family gatherings, strangers in arcades...if Mario Kart 64 is present, we can hang out. Complete the star cup and relive some shared nostalgia.
"Shake Shake!" your enemies into submission as Marina in her quest to rescue her creator, Prof. Theo, from the Emperor of Planet Clancer!
The Yoshi's need to get their Super Happy Tree back so they can live in ecstasy forever!
The game I'd play every Christmas break with my family. The game I still go to if I just need to run around and have fun for a bit. Truly a game that sparks joy!
Could anything give you more joy than infiltrating Shadow Moses? This whole game is such a great experience and you can play the twin snakes version for even more fun
Goemon and friends once again go on adventure. This time to stop Bismaru, who's stolen Wise Man's Ressurection machine.

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater takes place in a 3D environment permeated by an ambience of punk rock and ska music. The player takes control of a variety of famous skateboarders and must complete missions by performing skateboarding tricks and collecting objects. The game offers several modes of gameplay, including a career mode in which the player must complete objectives and evolve their character's attributes, a free-play mode in which the player may skate without any given objective, and a multi-player mode that features a number of competitive games.

Play as a maintenance robot at an amusement park trying to gather the lost tickets before opening day in this colourful 3d platformer with an emphasis on puzzles and a shockingly good physics engine for the hardware.

Anakin, a small boy, is a slave living on awful planet Tatooine. His only joy in life is building a speeder from leftover parts and racing in Boonta Eve Classic. Give Anakin some joy by helping him win the podracing competition!

Return to your youth and play with a number of toys around the house completing time trials and silly missions guaranteed to make you smile, like using a helicopter to airdrop sugar cubes into a cup of coffee. Silly and fun!
Did you ever wish you could play Saving Private Ryan on your Playstation while making Joe Lieberman clutch his pearls? Well here's your chance with the game that popularlized WW2 shooters.
YA YA YA YA YA!
An alternate story 7 years after the Outer haven Uprising in the Metal Gear Series.
You are Conker, a foul mouthed squirrel who just woke up with a horrible hangover and a missing girlfriend. Time to go on a whacky adventure to get her back.

During a holiday visit to sunny Isle Delfino, Mario is arrested for mysterious acts of vandalism perpetrated across the entire island by a shadowy individual that has assumed his identity. After being released from lockup, Mario must use a new water-spraying backpack named F.L.U.D.D. to wash away the harmful sludgy graffiti covering Isle Delfino and liberate the island's guardian Shine Sprites.
Go on an adventure as U-1, and discover the mystical powers of the Gitaroo in this cult classic music-rhythm game!
Lighthearted and funny Mario RPG where you travel to Beanbean kingdom to retrieve princess Peach's voice that was stolen from the bad witch Cackletta. Full of good times and laugh out loud jokes.

Set in the desert region of Orre, the player controls Wes, a former member of Team Snagem. Throughout the game, Wes rescues "Shadow Pokémon"—Pokémon who have had their hearts darkened by Team Cipher, an antagonistic organization—via snagging.
Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (KOTOR) is an  RPG video game based on the fictional universe of Star Wars by George Lucas set four thousand years before the films.

when Mario and Princess Peach get involved in the search for a mystic treasure that holds great fortune, Peach is kidnapped by an alien group called the X-Nauts; Mario sets out to find the treasure and save the princess.
Feel the kick as you blip the throttle of your favorite Ferrari, and blast across America from coast to coast, on an iconic OutRun soundtrack.
In your role as a planet, guide cheerfully singing LocoRocos through sidescrolling levels to defeat the invading Moja and restore peace.
A fun, comfy romp through the Original (and the best) trilogy of Star Wars, retold in classic LEGO style. My childhood, all on one disc.
In this game the player, whose father works at a robo research company, moves to a new town and shortly after engages in countless epic robo battles!

Take that! Ace Attorney Phoenix Wright returns in this fantastic follow up. Chock full of quality of life improvements, with writing and zany characters that keep up with the first game, this sequel refines and polishes the amazing base of the original.
You play as a god worshipped by little eyeball monsters called Patapon, and lead them into rhythmic battle against their enemies, the Zigotons, using war drums you acquire along the way. FEVER!!!
Ivy the Kiwi? is an action/puzzle game created by yuji naka, creator of Sonic the Hedgehog, that stars a baby bird as she navigates through 2D landscapes.
Take control of Alex or Nina in this tennis RPG as you work your way up the Royal Academy to become the greatest tennis player in the kingdom, taking on other players and Nintendo legends.

Set two years after the events of (the amazing) Valkyria Chronicles, take control of Avan Hardins, a young man enrolled in a military academy seeking the truth behind his deceased brother in this unique blend of TRPG with third-person shooter mechanics.

Play as the bounty hunter Garian in this unique blend of action-adventure and fighting games.  This game features a non-linear narrative  in which the player can end up in one of several different "parallels" depending on how quickly they complete the game's opening sequence.
This hybrid action game has side scrolling levels akin to Ninja Gaiden, driving levels, and shooting levels and is often included in “hidden gem” lists for the NES.

A far more charming remake of the NES title Linus Spacehead, this is a fun mash up of a point & click adventure with platforming sections, as well as one or two top down racing bits. Cosmic has crash landed onto the planet Earth. Help him find his way home and get proof he can take with him of this strange and alien planet. My personal favourite Megadrive game.

The sequel to hit GOTM of the last. This time you can choose from 2 characters with different stories! Also besides fishing, you can also dive in this one. Catch bugs, punch animals, dive, and go fishing in this game.
In this mix of Shmup and Action Adventure you explore dungeons and turn into a spaceship for shmup sequences.
I'd argue this is an RPG/sports title personally

Experience one of the greatest games ever made that barely sold at all due to timing and lack of marketing. The Panzer Dragoon series goes from rail shooter to RPG! Ride on the back of your dragon and fight enemies in semi-turn based battles.

The most expensive videogame ever developed in its time, Shenmue blends a martial arts revenge story with life simulation elements, minigames and waiting for things to happen. I never said it was still that good at any of those things.

Tobal 2 is a fighting game with a Quest Mode that turns it into an hybrid RPG. Sleep in inns, use potions, and level up body parts as you fight through 6 dungeons. Character designs by Akira Toriyama at a buttery smooth 60FPS.
Race! Punch and kick your way to the number one!
Inazuma Eleven is a role-playing sports game for the Nintendo DS developed and published by Level-5. A great Level-5 RPG that uses football/soccer matches for its "battle" system.

I'm just here for the Chao Garden, but there are multiple different gameplay and level types depending on the characters you are playing. Fast-paced platforming for Sonic/Shadow, shooting corridors for Tails/Eggman, and action-adventure treasure hunting for Knuckles/Rouge.

Embark on an open-world journey in "Gun", Neversoft's seamless blend of shooter, RPG, and fighting elements set in the harsh American West. Its captivating narrative, by famed author Randall Jahnson, features voices from Hollywood stalwarts like Thomas Jane, Kris Kristofferson, Lance Henriksen, and Ron Perlman, delivering an unforgettable gaming experience.

Early on, the player is given the choice between three different game modes, each with unique cutscenes, puzzles to solve and locations to visit: the Team Path, the Wits Path, and the Fists Path. In the Team Path, protagonist Indiana Jones is joined by his partner Sophia Hapgood who will provide support throughout the game.[11] The Wits Path features an abundance of complex puzzles, while the Fists Path focuses heavily on action sequences and fist fighting, the latter of which is completely optional in the other two modes.

Soccer game with RPG elements. Gameplay looks like 2-screens. Bottom screen is your play field showing the players. Top screen follows the player with the ball. Encounters with other players play like a turn-based RPG but matches don't last long. North America release changed the characters. Japan release is in Japanese but has a translation and it is based on a manga/anime. Your main character has a progression as in an RPG and energy points (like mana)

Star in your own 1950s B-Movie in a game which include Adventure, FPS, Flight Sim, Defence/Strategy, and 2d Fighting among others. Investigate a meteor strike and find the local townsfolk acting WEIRD. Try to work out what’s going (clue: it’s giant ants). If you fail, use what you learnt to do better next time (like The Outer Wilds).

As a citizen of the kingdom of Bartonia, it's your job to discover why the Undead have begun swarming all over the world of Etheria. In this RPG hybrid you'll be following the story of your character as they rid Etheria of the Undead scourge and save Bartonia, complete sidequests for extra money, experience, items and companions, craft your own weapons and armor, capture monsters for use as mounts or to learn their spells, and even lay siege to neighboring kingdoms in order to add them to your own empire. However, Puzzle Quest is an RPG with a twist. Everything is done (as the name implies) with puzzles.
A fighting/RPG--walk around and fight other people's collectible robot with your robot. Fight to collect experience  and upgrade the parts on your robot.

The game features a character named Jason who follows his pet frog Fred down a hole in the earth. There he finds a tank and uses it to battle radioactive mutants. The player controls Jason and the tank Sophia the 3rd through eight levels of gameplay to find the whereabouts of Fred and to defeat the mutants and their leader, the Plutonium Boss.
Go from Exploring Dungeons and hacking away at enemies in small arenas to fighting bosses in a full screen fight.
Maken X is a first-person action hack and slash video game where players control a variety of characters wielding a sentient sword dubbed the Maken.
Delve into an alien conspiracy in this Action-adventure/shooter/RPG hybrid with a professional wrestling inspired RPG combat system!

As Tron, of the Bonne Family of Air Pirates, work to pay off your Father's debt by any means necessary, especially crime!  A prequel and spin-off to Mega Man Legends, The Misadventures of Tron Bonne is a genre blending extravaganza. Steal cargo in puzzle levels, blow up robots in action levels and find hidden treasure in adventure stages, all with different styles of gameplay.  Not to mention the Servbot management which will have you serving lunch, completing target practice and whipping them back into shape if they get too lazy (who knows? sometimes you might just find their special skill)  This thing is content rich and is a fantastic late entry into the PS1 line-up.

The Adventure of Link is a direct sequel to the original The Legend of Zelda, again involving the protagonist Link, on a quest to save Princess Zelda, who has fallen under a sleeping spell. The game's emphasis on side-scrolling and role-playing elements is a significant departure from its predecessor.
Here players step into the unlucky shoes of a penguin called a Prinny and 999 of his comrades as you slash your way through various Netherworld areas in side-scrolling service to the Demon Lord Etna.

At one point they were going to make this a sonic game. But it was too good so they made it a game in its own right. Part metroidvania, part RPG, part platformer, this game is a unique blend of genres and one of the best games on the Sega CD. Plus it has animated cutscenes. We have to try this one.

One rare Sega saturn game, that was only released in Japan and Europe in a time were people didn't had interest in 2D games, making this game one hidden gem. The game combines platforming with shmup stages. Truly beautiful and surely one of its kind.
Third person adventure! Side-on fighting! FPS! Three types of game in one! Talk about ambitious. Inhabit NPCs and solve some murders. The Davids (Cage and Bowie) want you to play this.
Ralph was a swordsman, turned into a child by a fell curse. Hop through beautiful platformer stages as Little Ralph, and challenge bosses in an arcade fighting game in his true form.

Mickey and his friends must compete in several racing tracks. In the village, they can get cool stuff and buy upgrades for their cars and boats. To access a new world, they also need to solve a puzzle!

Star Wars: Shadows of the Empire is an action game set between the time of The Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi. Play as Dash Rendar and relive battle of Hoth, fight in space, race with a speeder or fly with a jetpack.
This game starts off exactly like the arcade DK game but quickly becomes an amazing puzzle-platformer with 101 unique stages to complete.
Play as a teen who is good at golf and use your skills to defeat a mad scientist from taking over the world. Crazy story, golf with rpg elements what's not to love.

This game sees the four main characters - Ultraman, Kamen Rider, SD Knight Gundam and Fighter Roar - fight their usual enemies on a Wild West planet. The levels are split between 2D side-scrolling platformer/action stages and third-person shooter stages that resemble those from Natsume's popular Wild Guns.
Explore Zelda-like dungeons in this 2D Action RPG! Rescue adorable Poms that will fight at your side! And then...build them a village and raise them up! Also, trading cards.
The world has been destroyed by an evil genie and it's up to you to put the pieces back together! Blends 3rd-person, dungeon crawling with lite, city building in the overworld. A classic!

The player takes on the role of the eponymous Chibi-Robo, a 10-centimeter-tall robot owned by the Sanderson family. Gameplay revolves around navigating a household and collecting "Happy Points" by completing various tasks from housework to helping solve the dilemmas of the Sanderson family and the numerous living toys that inhabit their household. Every action consumes energy, requiring the player to recharge using electrical outlets.
It's kind of like pokémon Mystery Dungeon with a turn-based rock-paper-scissors battle system and you get to collect little monsters.

Treasure Conflix is a hybrid between mode 7 airship dogfights, and a treasure hunting RPG. It was released by Squaresoft exclusively on the Satellaview, and recently translated in English by fans, for the 1st time.
Genres: Rail shooter, plataform

Join White Bomberman in a reimagining of his original arcade release as he places bombs to deal with foes and save his creator's daughter from the clutches of Black Bormebrman! A classic puzzle game that's fun for everyone!

Everyone remembers this game for the unfitting, but kindly old man on the cover of this epic, frantic, spaceship shoot'em up. Swap between weapons on the fly or sacrifice them ot perform powerful special moves!

A homicidal alien race is invading the Earth, and the only thing that stands between them and world domination are a special forces team known as the "Alien Busters"! A unique beat'em up with 3PS and shmup style sections!

After the success of Samurai Showdown, SNK took another stab at a 2D weapon-based fighter. Though not garnering as much attention as other SNK titles, The Last Blade has become something of a fighting game cult classic.

What if Outrun was a futuristic shoot'em up and your car could fly? In Night Striker, take to the skies and streets, blast foes, and at the end of each stage, your path will determine which level you'll see next, and your ending!

The first adventrue of the bravest opossum rocket knight: Sparkster! Using your sword and jetpack, dash, boost, and slash your way through a multitude of levels to defeat an evil empire of pigs in this cult classic!

What better time to defeat Jason Voorhees? Shift control between 6 camp counselors at Camp Crystal Lake and try to kill Jason... Before he does the same to you! This cryptic puzzle adventure will surely frighten you...

Terrorist robots are running rampant! Take control of one of Capcom's familiar faces (or the all-new Simone) and take the fight to them, blasting and attacking while using your motor boots in this unique Dreamcast hidden gem.

Dimps' first title, and their first of three attempts to introduce classic Sonic to a new audience with Sonic Adventure-esque flair. Play as Sonic, Tails, Knuckles, or Amy, take down Eggman, and raise a Tiny Chao in between!

Pick one of four pilots and take flight in 7 different levels, some of which are presented in random order! Each pilot has their own stats, shot pattern, and bomb, so try them all out until one clicks! There are two sequels on Neo Geo!
When the evil baron Morbius captures Princess Eleanor, the wizard Shadax must navigate 250 rooms within the fortress Kastlerock and assemble the six pieces of the Staff of Demnos to defeat him.

R.C. pro Am in your pocket! Race across 24 different tracks, grabbing upgrades, powerups, and the letters to spell NINTENDO so you can upgrade your R.C. car to the next racing class and win the Nintendo Champion cup!

Engage in thrilling, over-the-shoulder swordplay, timing your dodging and blocking while countering with strikes of your own! Multiple pathways and an intuitive, yet complex combat system offers plenty of replay value!

Team up as SD (super deformed) versions of various characters from Banpresto's Compati Hero series, featuring a crossover between Kamen Rider, Ultraman, Metal Hero, and Gundam as you fight to save Emi!

This Turbografx-16/PC Engine-exclusive shoot'em up takes you through 6 stages. The twist here is that your powerups count as your hit points; take some damage and instead of dying, you'll only lose a powerup.

Take control of Alisia in a quest to avenge her father and save the world. Alisia can summon lightning from her hands, but must charge it fro maximum effect. Luckily, she has 4 swappable monster allies to watch her back!

Capcoms first in-house polygonal fighter, Star Gladiator is like Soul Calibur with a futuristic aesthetic. Learn how to do Plasma Reverses, Plasma Reflects, and Plasma Combos to defeat the evil Bilstein!

An unlicensed puzzle game published by American Video Entertainment Inc, Krazy Kreatures has you klearing kreatures by matching them in rows, kolumns, or diagonals by 3 or more. Simple to learn and great with a friend!

Really "use your head" as Hudonsosoft's caveman mascot Bonk to headbutt, bounce, and just get really angry through a plethora of stages. Make sure you don't play NES port; levels have been cut and shuffled for a lesser experience.

A key title in the "cute'em up" genre, Cotton follows the eponymous with as she saves a magical world from a dark mist... In exchange for her favorite candy, of course. Blast foes, cast spells, and get help from fairy allies!
Go go Power Rangers! Take control of your favorite Megazord and do battle with other zords and foes from the beloved franchise. Time your special moves carefully to power up and do even more damage!

The Genesis remake of the 1986 MSX title, control schoolgirl Yoko Asou as she is begrudgingly fated to protect the three realms. Slide, jump, slash, and upgrade your sword, defeating bosses to utilize their powerful magics.

In Radishland, each town has a time key which keeps time flowing regularly. When a bad man shows up and starts stealing time keys, it's up to Zac and Mel and their magic sticks to retrieve the time keys and save Radishland!

Oops! Witch Ripple has accidentally released six demons from a forbidden tome and now it's up to her and her two star companions, Topsy and Turvy, to stop them, seal them back into the tome, and save the world!

Has sonic finally met his match? Sonic CD introduces Sonic's greatest rival yet: Metal Sonic! The Blue Blur must travel through space and time to try and create a Good Future and to free Little Planet from Robotnik!

The demon Balrog has taken over the earth, with the exception of the last human kingdom of Dirzir. When Dirzir's princess is captured, it's up to the four heroes to quest forth and find her in this action adventure arcade RPG!

Pick your favorite Digimon from the first 3 seasons of the show and duke it out on a variety of different stages in this Smash Brothers-like platform fighter! Digivolve at opportune times and unleash your special move!

Start spooky season off the right way with the #1 horror virtual pinball game: Devil's Crush! With a free scrolling triple-tiered playfield and many bonus rooms, Devil's Crush is one virtual pinball game you won't soon forget!

When Rick and his girlfriend Jennifer are trapped inside the infamous Splatterhouse, Rick meets his end while Jennifer is taken away. Resurrected by the Terror Mask, Rick begins a violent, gruesome quest.
15 years after the events of Castlevania: The Adventure, Dracula kidnaps Christopher Belmont's son Soleil. Featuring a level select system, Chris must head out to stop Dracula once again.

Those slimy Sardinis! Tehy think they got the last laugh on Polterguy by selling him a janky skateboard, but he's gonna have th elast laugh! Possess objects around the Sardini's homes and really teach them a lesson!

THE premier horror-themed 2D fighting game! As any number of classic montsers, stop the evil alien Pyron on his quest to devour Earth. Humankind stands no chance, so now it's up to the monsters to step up!

Reborn as a cyborg ninja, Hagane must take revenge on an enemy ninja clan. With four different weapons to swap through, air-dashes, wall-clings, and more, Hagane has all the tools he needs at his disposal.

Love Metal Slug? How about some Metal Slug in your pocket! This tiny Metal Slug features all the things you know and love about the popular run'n gun franchise, turned tiny! Find powerups, multiple paths, and pilot machines!

The follow-up to Pulstar, Blazing star improves on the shoot'em up formula by offering combos the player can pull off by mashing the B button during a powered up shot. Collect powerups and try different machines!

When the princess of the dream land is kidnapped, it's up to you to save her. Tapir will let you choose any form in your dream, so create a character and use each part's unique strengths to save the princess!

When the twin princesses are captured, it's up to Nick and Tom to use their snowy powers to save the day! In this Bubble Bobble-like, defeat enemies by turning them into sonwballs, then rolling them into each other!

When Santa's elves go on strike due to overworking for high demands of Christmas toys, Santa has to find a way to whip them back into shape! The elves may be on strike, but Santa will get a few strikes of his own!

When Santa gets zapped and kidnapped by an evil witch, it's up to little Nick to find the missing presents, defeat the witch, and rescue everyone's favorite Claus. If this won't get you int othe holiday spirit, nothing will.

One day, Kickle wakes up to find his entire homeland, the Fantasy Kingdom, has been turned to ice by the evil Wicked Wizard King. With Kickle's ice breath attack, he sets out to collect the red Dream Bags and save the day!

Unholy Night: The Darkness Hunter is a fighting game created by former members of SNK. When they failed to meet their kickstarter goal, Retroism stepped in to publish it and give this retro 2D fighter a chance.
The first of the Game Boy TMNT games, take control of the turtles to defeat TMNT villains such as Bebop, Rocksteady, Baxter Stockman, Shredder, and Krang, on a quest ot rescue April O'Neil.

Choose one of eight characters, each with their own special weapon, then pick one of three paths to take the fight to the Bloody Scorpions terrorist group who have a deadly plot to steal a drug capable of creating supersoldiers.

Leave it to Lammy! In this sequel/spiritual successor to PaRappa the Rapper, take control of anxiety-ridden guitarist Lammy of band Milk Can as she tries to make it to her shouw, but not before a TON of shenanigans!

When the climate control system on SD island went haywire, evil creatures started appearing. V3, Taro, and Knight Gundam went out to investigate but never returned... Can Rider 1, Ultraman, and Gundam save the day?

The original run'n gun that all others nstrive for! Take control of Lance or Bill and take out the evil Red Falcon Organization's secret island base! Don't forget your Konami Code; you might need those extra 30 lives!
