The sequel to Balloon Fight, take control of Alice on a journey to save the hero of Balloon Fight, complete with stages, bosses, and the ability to detach your balloons and inflate new ones! Go, Balloon Kid!
Wark! Now's your chance to race with classic Squaresoft characters! Play the story mode and hepl Chocobo as he tries to win the pieces of the legendary Blue Crystal from the other racers. Kweh!

Fly through 6 stages in this cute'em up based on the manga of the same name. Taruruuto-kun has a tendency to turn objects into sentient creatures, so you'll have to fix his mistakes! Get some powerups and blast away!

Take control of the Prince, Fairy, or Dragon and quest across the land to find the three keys so you can prevent the King of Darkness from resurrecting an ancient demon. Beat montsers, level up, save the world!

The evil witch Morticia has trapped Spanky in a tower guarded by her magical fruit minions! Use your wits and balls from various sports to defeat enemies, collect keys, battle Morticia, and escape her tower!

This just in: Aliens are invading Earth and forcing Earthlings to... Dance? Stay tuned to Space Channel 5 to find out all of developments, featuring our star reporter: Ulala! She'll dance to save the day!

In the 1930s, ships sailing near the Bahamas have been mysteriously going missing. The U.S. Marines send out a search party and discover Greenhell Isle, populated by dinosaurs, long though to be extinct! Well, they will be!

Well, looks like Robotnik is back at it again. Having collected all of the Chaos Emeralds, he's out to create some sort of nuclear weaponry and it's up to our old friends Sonic and Miles "Tails" Prower to take care of him once more.

Experience the Last Blade in the palm of your hand, then put it in your pocket! In this Neo Geo Pokcet Color rendition of The Last Blade, complete story mode and collect endings and gallery scrolls fro some nice replay value.

Deadeus centers around a small boy who has a prophetic nightmare telling him everyone will die in 3 days and that he has to investigate his village to see how he can save them, if at all. Deadeus has 11 endings and no direct path.

Grab your broom and take to the skies in this cute'em up! Features powerups and the ability to throw and swing your broom to block projectiles, as well as seamlessly transitioning from flying to run and gun style segments!

Oh no! Penny has been kidnapped by Dr. Claw and his MAD soldiers! Good thing Gadget is on the case! Use a wide variety of gadgets to tackle platforming challenges in a plethora of interesting and unique ways!

When Ryan's girlfriend Cyndi is kidnapped by local gang leader Slick, it's up to Ryan and his friend Alex to beat up the thugs and save her! Features RPG elements, like increasing your stats by buing items and learning new attacks!

Winners don't use drugs! As Max Force and Hit Man, take teh war on drugs to the streets as you attempt to bust king pin Mr. Big and his plethora of drug selling lackies! Pakcing a rifle and missile launcher, just say NO!

Follow a hacker's journey into a malfunctioning AI as you blast enemies to the musical beats. The game was designed to emulate synesthesia and share its story via minimal dialogue and instead through thematic references to life.
Control Nova and his powerful boomerangs through action-platforming challenges reminiscent of Mega Man! Nova can throw his boomerangs in 8 directions, power them up to fly farther, and throw more!

Take control of one of 13 King of Fighters characters, in chibi-style of coures, and go punch Geese Howard in his little chibi face! As is true of all the NGPC figthers, you can expect smooth controls and solid sprite work.

It's time for the Great Ragtime Show! Pilot a biplane with a giant hook attached to grab items, deal damage, and drop bombs on foes! A unique and fun shoot'em up with a World War I mixed with steampun aesthetic.

The Legend of Zelda meets Disney? Capcom created an amazing multiplayer, Zelda-like experience here, don't let the licencsing fool you! As Max or Goofy, use various tools like grappling hooks to solve puzzles and defeat Pete and his crew!

Based on the manga and anime series Ghost Sweeper Mikami, take control of Reiki, the exorcist with the  "Nice Body," and take on all sorts of ghosts and ghoullies with your magically charged baton! No translation available.

In this unique fighter, control a fighter flying within a 3D psychic field. Fly around to dodge psychic blasts and answer with attacks of your own, or dash in and get up close and personal with combo attacks!

Pilot a mech that can transform into a fighter jet in this unique 3D action game. Hidden across each level is a navigator who will guide you to your mission objectives and provide support, as well as alter your ending!

Part of the notoriously reskinned Crazy Castle series, join Kid Klown in an effort to defeat the evil Night Mayor after he klownnaps your family! Use balloons as projectiles and to assist you in platforming challenges.

Take control of an attack helicopter in this military-themed shoot'em upShoot down foes to obtain powerups and bombs, including multiple shot types, and fly in lower to get up clos and personal with some powerful foes.

A game in both the Bomberman and Blaster Master frinheses, Blaster Master Boy/Jr., a direct sequel to RoboWarrior, has players controlling Jason from Bsatre Master as he exploes dungeons and bombs obstacles.

Eight travelling fighters brought together by a common destiny, now meet at the Battle Arena Toshinden... A PS1 classic fighter criically acclaimed in its time, but... Does its legacy still hold up? You decide!

CYBER-LIP! So much more than "Contra at home," Cyber-Lip is a solid, futuristic run 'n gun for Neo Geo that many missed out on due to its platform. Fun solo or with a friend, collect weapons and fire while hanging!

Things have taken a strange turn in Iwatodai. A weird 25th hour occurs just after midnight and only a few can experience it. When you are faced with a limited amount of time, who ill you spend it with? Memento Mori.
The first game in the fifth generation of the beloved franchise, Black and White see Pokémon Trainers travelling across the Unova region, capturing Pokémon to train them and be Pokémon Masters.
When wild Digimon begin attacking towns, it's up to the guard teams to maintain peace. As Akira, join one of three guard teams, raise Digimon, and battle them 3-on-3, leveling and Digivolving.
Taking place after the second Super Robot Wars, take control of a number of popular mecha from Banpresto's Gundam, Getter Robo, Mazinger series and more as you engage in tactical battle.
The third (and so far, final) Tactics spin off for the Final Fantasy series. This time, control Luso and his clan as he is magically transported to Ivalice seeking a way to return home.
When a terrorist organization called Odessa tries to conquer the world, take control of an international anti-terrorist group called ARMS to combat them.
Take to the streets in this unique racing RPG, which focuses on eam Bay Lagoon Racing's newest recruit, Sho Akasaki, who is determined to learn the truth behind the fabled Fastest Legend race.
Inspired by Norse mythology control Lenneth, as she travels through Midgard, collecting souls of slain heroes to serve her either as einherjar, or her personal companions.

Based on the hit 1986 game show of the same name, Double Dare has players competing in a plethora of physical challenges and answering trivia questions in an effort to challenge the Double Dare obstacle course and win big prizes!
Dragon Quest combat, FFV class system, and Earthbound humor. Looks like a fun and unique rpg experience for the snes.

In this unique Doom Engine game, control an unnamed mercenary doing battle against the Order, a mutated religious fanatic group. Features consumable items and quests in what is one of the first blendings of RPG and FPS action. Multiple endings! Level up your skills! Modern remake available on PC and Switch by gods of old boomer shooter remakers: Nightdive.

A colorful platformer with nice music, boss fights and cutscenes with story between stages. You pick one of the three main cats and then use several others throughout levels to progress. You change characters on the fly. There are flying, swimming, rock-breaking cats amongst others. Every cat has their own attacks, special abilities and 3-tiered special attacks as well. It has goofy enemy designs. You can easily play it in the original language too if you don't care about the story. Game mechanics aren't hard to figure out.

In SkiFree, you're a perpetually downhill-bound skier whose main opponent isn't the mountain—it's an insatiable yeti with an appetite for winter athletes. It's less of a winter wonderland and more of a "how long can I avoid becoming a yeti's snack?" simulator.

Comix Zone is a 1995 beat 'em up video game, set within the panels of a comic book with dialogue rendered within talk bubbles and sprites, and backgrounds possessing the bright colors and dynamic drawing style of superhero comics.

Threads of Fate is an action role-playing game developed and published by Square for the PlayStation, released for Japan in 1999 and for North America in 2000. The story is split between two protagonists in search of an ancient relic said to grant any wish; the amnesiac Rue who seeks to revive a dead friend, and the banished princess Mint who dreams of conquering the world. Gameplay focuses on action-based combat while exploring dungeon levels featuring minor platforming elements.

Third-person platforming game where players control Evo, a robot who is reduced to a crawling microchip during a ship crash. The game's storyline revolves around a space station initially designed as a "technologically advanced amusement park" and home to numerous robotic animals - each with their own unique attributes - which Evo must assume control of in order to traverse the multitude of environments in the space station.

Bully is the famous Rockstar game which everyone has been waiting for a sequel but ultimately was cancelled by the gaming company. The game follows a juvenile delinquent student James "Jimmy" Hopkins as he was involuntarily enrolled in an Academy boarding school for a year.

Like many game concepts, Soul of the Samurai‘s results from the mixing of ideas popular at the time of its creation. Tenchu and Bushido Blade had shown the potential of a more serious take on sword fighting and feudal Japan, while the breakout success of Capcom’s Resident Evil series led to a wave of horror titles from its competitors. And so, right around the time Konami’s Tokyo studio was working on Silent Hill, its recently-established Sapporo branch was busy incorporating these disparate influences into a new formula. As a result, Soul of the Samurai is an action-adventure title in which you use bladed weapons to fight zombies and monsters within pre-rendered renditions of feudal Japan.

In this satirical action/strategy game control a small military group where each individual specializes in a certain weapon (machine gun, flame thrower, rocket launcher, grenades, dynamite) are used to battle and settle a score between two military dictator brothers with a long standing feud about a comic book.
Isometric puzzling to remove the ban over all music performance in their land.

Illusion of Gaia is an ARPG for the SNES. In an alternate 16th century Earth, you play as a cool dude name of Will who has to save the world from DISASTER. Along your journey, you get to visit all sorts of cool real-world ruins and cultural sites, like the Great Wall of China, the Great Pyramid, and the Nazca Lines.

You’re a ghost, also a detective. Save the lives of others by inhabiting objects to affect the environment around you and change the outcome of events around you. Nominating this because I really want to play it and this will push it to the top of my backlog.

You're a ninja, also a cop.  Navigate the levels and defeat the terrorists with an assortment of ninja tools, including a grappling hook, a sword, and shurikens in this now rare and highly sought-after action platformer.

A Game Boy roguelike! Listen to a great soundtrack as you take on progressively more difficult quests across four dungeons. Cave Noire is easy to play in short bursts, quick to learn, and gets difficult quickly.

Often described as "Medieveil Strider" GamePro lauded Skyblazer as "a great mix of side-scrolling action, puzzle solving, special powers, and tactics." They praised the challenge, mythological setting, simple controls, and "inventive uses of Mode 7."

Critically acclaimed as the best Shmup for PS1, as well as one of the best ever in its category, Einhander will certainly surprise you with its music, fantastic graphics and its difficulty which, although high, becomes fair compared to other games on the same style.

"Like the over-caffeinated and downright looney love child of the Super Smash Bros. and the Bomberman series" Ooga Booga is a goofy third person arena game that really shines as a couch multiplayer game, but has a fun single player campaign as well.
3D platformer I've been meaning to try for a while. Neo is a robot that can charge himself. Play with magnetic physics!
Challenging but rewarding vertical scrolling shoot em up game where you switch between white and black polarity mode.
A disturbing Castlevania-like 2D side scrolling game, with guns. Literally go through hell and turn into demons, to help your dead wife and daughter. Japan-only, English patch available.

Wendy accidentally opens her aunts' chest containing magical stones, which upset the gravity of a floating castle that crashes onto her house. The player controls Wendy through four worlds with sixteen levels, with each world having three side-scrolling levels and one horizontal shooter stag. Hoping that I get the correct HLTB tag this time.
Play as a monster who fights monsters in this charming hop and bop boss rush
Play as a monster who fights monsters in this charming hop and bop boss rush

How did we miss this game last month? It’s literally a hybrid of tamagotchi and metroidvania - you raise your pet Chomp on the bottom screen to learn new abilities while working through a fun platformer on the top screen. Thankfully it’s a standalone game as well as a genre mashup.

Known as Sheep Raider in North America, this game is a stealth platformer where you have to figure out a way to steal sheep without getting caught by the guard dog Sam. Giant anvils, painted roads, time travel, everything's fair game. Also famous for its amazing soundtrack, this game is often called one of the hidden gems of the system, due to an unfortunate release date killing its momentum at the time.
Vanguard Bandits is a support-centric strategy RPG featuring tactical combat in a medieval fantasy world in which knights and soldiers pilot mecha.
The definition of "a sequel is coming :tmsoon:". Action! Stealth! Story! Using your trusty camera and bo staff, expose the DomZ conspiracy and save Hillys.
This game is unique in many ways. It’s exclusive to North America. It’s an ambitious RTS for Game Boy Color. And where else have you seen a pig with a sword?

This modern take on the top-down shooter genre takes all the inspiration of the style and the sci-fi action movies of the era and creates an incredible and deeply challenging game. Outpost 88, a scientific research facility is overrun by aliens. The facility sent a distress signal, leading Commander Darius dispatching space marines John Marsh and Sarah Ridley to confront the aliens.

Play as Jackie Chan as you have to rescue his grandpa, like a 'Snake in The Eagle's Shadow'. 'Rush Hour' your way past numerous villains in different locations across NYC. This ain't your usual 'Police Story'.
Play as Snotty Ragsdale as he transforms into his alter ego, Boogerman, to recover the stolen power source of Professor Stinkbaum's machine that will save the world from polution.

Your friends are all missing, they're stuck in a haunted amusement park and you need to explore it find them? Throw in a dash of family trauma and you get Illbleed, the unique and innovative horror game for Dreamcast, and a B movie in playable form.

"Shake Shake!" your enemies into submission as Marina in her quest to rescue her creator, Prof. Theo, from the Emperor of Planet Clancer!  Features unique "catch, shake and throw" mechanics, a unique aesthetic and some insane boss fights, as is tradition for Treasure.

The world of Mushihimesama is a wild, untainted one where large desertic areas abruptly change into lush forests, all inhabited by arthropods called Koujuu: such beasts (basically oversized insects) are capable of surviving due to their hardened shells and, upon their deaths, leave them behind for vegetation to grow around them, in a natural cycle of life and death.
A game with absolutely no influence on internet culture, Zero Wing is a very enjoyable horizontal shoot em up with a kick-ass soundtrack and a legendarily bad translation. Move ZIG!
Play a classic that unfortunately never made it outside of Japan until 2022. Play as seven different characters in seven different settings for one of the most unique concepts for an RPG ever!
The cult-classic gallery shooter with a Sci-fi-Western theme and kickin' tunes! Signature 90s Natsume style and polish!
Parin is invited to Monster Village -- just when Phantoms invade. Only the Legendary Drill can beat back the Phantoms, and Parin sets off to find it.
When an alien spacecraft crashes into an unknown planet, a young boy named Terry is tasked with collecting decals in order to help the professor who runs the craft continue his journey.

Make this that rarest of beasts - a four time nomination which makes it to the winners circle. In this game you play as mister domino, or one of his family as you set up and knocking over dominoes in a game described as as “A sure sleeper hit, a puzzle game” by IGN. Basically this is one of the hidden gems that everyone should play, and enjoy.

Billy Hatcher is a 3D platform game whose gameplay revolves around growing and hatching eggs to defeat the Crows. The player controls Billy, who cannot do much by himself aside from moving and jumping. However, his abilities greatly expand while holding an egg. While rolling an egg, Billy moves faster and is more agile. He can also perform several techniques with an egg, such as egg dunking, slamming, dashing, and shooting.

Attack of the Friday Monsters! A Tokyo Tale is an adventure game designed by Kaz Ayabe, who is known in Japan for the popular Boku no Natsuyasumi series. It puts you in the role of Sohta, a young boy living in Fuji no Hana, a small Japanese town where giant monsters run amok every Friday night.

A hybrid science fiction role-playing-space-shooter where you explore a standard 2-D overworld, but are transported into space for side-scrolling shooter random battles. The story focuses on a space pilot named Ian Recker who goes undercover against Earth's enemies, the Krill, in a battle to save the planet.

Scurge: Hive is an action-adventure video game by Orbital Media released for the Game Boy Advance and Nintendo DS in 2006. The game follows the protagonist Jenosa Arma, a female bounty hunter tasked with hunting a parasitic lifeform called the "Scurge" an alien entity capable of rapidly adapting to and infecting biological, mechanical, and digital systems, including the player. Throughout the game, Jenosa Arma will have to battle various forms of the Scurge virus and race against the clock as the parasite slowly takes over Jenosa's body. The gameplay takes place in an isometric perspective.

Technically a GBA version of The King of Fighters '99, Neo Blood features a new character as players learn who the mysetrious sponsor of this year's King of Fighters Tournament is and the reason for Iori Yagami's disappearance

Long ago, far away in space, there existed a "Fantasy Zone" where a courageous hero called Opa-Opa (the player) fought in a valiant cause to rescue the "Fantasy Zone" from its enemies. Collect coins and upgrades!

In Kirby's debut adventure, venture forth on a quest to defeat King Dedede who has stolen all of Dream Land's food! Kirby can fly and inhale foes and spit them back out as stars, in this fun, quick, easy romp.
